channel.title: Installing xorg and kde on Arch
channel.description:
Its all fixed now, I didnt set my servers properly. Im now installing xfce!
[s]I did a clean install of Arch and is working perfectly in CLI however I want to get KDE or possibly Xfce. So I started off synchronizing the package database (pacman -Syu) and then tried to install xorg (pacman -S xorg) however Arch tells me that [/s] [code]error: cannot resolve "expat>=2.0", a dependency of "fontconfig" error: failed to prepare transaction (could not satisfy dependencies) :: fontconfig: requires expat>=2.0[/code]
[s]The ovious thing to [b]me[/b] was to check "pacman -Ss expat" and theres one package but when I try to install it, I am told I need expat to install it which really confuses me.
Any ideas how to fix? I should note that this is an old version (2008.06), would the new cd solve this? (I want to check before wasting an age downloading and then installing arch)[/s]

item.title: Installing xorg and kde on Arch
item.dc:creator: @chrisn2323 chrisn2323
item.description:
@chrisn2323 wrote:

[quote=“Fat Cookies, post:5, topic:277170”][quote author=sppt link=topic=365824.msg2776503#msg2776503 date=1241558284]
Switch servers then
[/quote]
But on /etc/pacman.conf it is set as “mirrorlist” so it should find at least one server?

I’ve waited a day I am still getting the same problem and when i do “pacman -Syu” Im told that it failed to update any databases (Unexpected Error)[/quote]
move a different mirror to the top of the mirrorlist

Read full topic
item.source: Installing xorg and kde on Arch

@Cheese_Police wrote:

Are you sure it is connected to your network properly?

item.title: Installing xorg and kde on Arch
item.dc:creator: @Fat_Cookies Fat Cookies
item.description:
@Fat_Cookies wrote:

sppt:

Switch servers then

But on /etc/pacman.conf it is set as “mirrorlist” so it should find at least one server?

I’ve waited a day I am still getting the same problem and when i do “pacman -Syu” Im told that it failed to update any databases (Unexpected Error)

Read full topic

item.title: Installing xorg and kde on Arch
item.dc:creator: @sppt sppt
item.description:
@sppt wrote:

[quote=“Fat Cookies, post:3, topic:277170”]Unfortunatly that solution did not work so I decided to reinstall arch and when selecting packages during install I ticked them all instead of just selecting the default packages .

When i did “pacman -S xorg” on the new install the dependency thing was OK however when I selected Yes to install im plauged with another error:

error: failed to retrieve some files from core

It seems the server is down. Only patience can solve that![/quote]
Switch servers then

Read full topic
item.source: Installing xorg and kde on Arch

item.title: Installing xorg and kde on Arch
item.dc:creator: @Fat_Cookies Fat Cookies
item.description:
@Fat_Cookies wrote:

Unfortunatly that solution did not work so I decided to reinstall arch and when selecting packages during install I ticked them all instead of just selecting the default packages .

When i did “pacman -S xorg” on the new install the dependency thing was OK however when I selected Yes to install im plauged with another error:

error: failed to retrieve some files from core

It seems the server is down. Only patience can solve that!

Read full topic
item.source: Installing xorg and kde on Arch

item.title: Installing xorg and kde on Arch
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

A newer CD shouldn’t matter, if you upgraded everything you should be at the current release.

Try doing this:

pacman -Syu xorg

Read full topic

item.description:

Its all fixed now, I didnt set my servers properly. Im now installing xfce!

I did a clean install of Arch and is working perfectly in CLI however I want to get KDE or possibly Xfce.
So I started off synchronizing the package database (pacman -Syu) and then tried to install xorg (pacman -S xorg) however Arch tells me that

error: cannot resolve "expat>=2.0", a dependency of "fontconfig" error: failed to prepare transaction (could not satisfy dependencies) :: fontconfig: requires expat>=2.0

[s]The ovious thing to me was to check “pacman -Ss expat” and theres one package but when I try to install it, I am told I need expat to install it which really confuses me.

Any ideas how to fix?
I should note that this is an old version (2008.06), would the new cd solve this? (I want to check before wasting an age downloading and then installing arch)[/s]
